item.description: Dynamically typed languages check variable type during runtime, meaning it is more error-prone.On the contrary, statically typed languages check variable type during compilation.
Why I created a programming language TLDR: I didn’t think about making a library for dynamic instantiation. I should’ve made a library - that is an optimal path.

item.title: ReGIna
item.description: is a dynamically typed language with syntax similar to Kotlin and Python. Core idea Difference between other languages and ReGIna is dynamic instantiation.

item.title: Syntax
item.description: Table of Contents Declarations Class Object Function Imports Operators Boolean operators Property/variable assignment References Cycles while foreach 1.

item.title: Visibility scopes
item.description: All scopes, sorted from the most visible to the least: Global scope In global scope classes, objects and functions are declared.
